channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-8305] distcp over viewfs is broken
item.description: This is similar to MAPREDUCE-4133. distcp over viewfs is broken because getDefaultReplication/BlockSize are being requested with no arguments.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
No tests attached since the changes should have been part of HADOOP-8014. I ran distcp on my local machine. The distcp tests I ran are the following:

viewfs -> hdfs
hdfs -> viewfs
viewfs -> viewfs

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12523855/HADOOP-8305.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 2 new or modified test files.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/880//console

This message is automatically generated.
Looks good, assuming the patch will apply. Should a few tests maybe be added to distcp to prevent regressions?
Attaching a file with discp over viewfs tests. These tests fail without the patch and pass with it.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12524290/HADOOP-8305.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified test files.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/888//console

This message is automatically generated.
+1 if the patch doesn't involve non-test changes to apply

I have been having trouble getting Jenkins to run for patches that I submitted into the hadoop-tools directory. The reason it does not build has nothing to do with the changes themselves. I did compile and run the test on my desktop before uploading the patch.

Yes Cross project/hadoop-tools precommit builds will not work until HADOOP-8308 goes in.

-1 overall.  

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 3 new or modified test files.

    -1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool appears to have generated 16 warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce 20 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

Which is the same as running with a noop patch

-1 overall.

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    -1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool appears to have generated 16 warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce 20 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

So +1 I'll commit your patch tomorrow.

Thanks John,

I put this into trunk, branch-2, and branch-0.23
